III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/27/25, a youth tried to hang themselves by wrapping an
object around their neck. The youth then ran to a staff member,
stating they could not breathe. The staff member took the object,
but it is unknown if medical attention was sought or if there was
resulting injury. When the facility social worker became aware,
they ensured the room was cleared of harmful objects and the
youth is now on precautions for two weeks.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 7/3/25.
Complainant reported after receiving the incident report, she felt
much better about the situation because it was a more complete
story. Complainant reported she no longer had concerns about
Youth A not receiving appropriate care after the incident.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/7/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported on
6/27/25, he was going to commit suicide because he was anxious
and had anxiety/depression because it was the day before the
anniversary of his mother’s death. Youth A reported he was in his
room and tied pants around his neck first, and then he tied a radio
cord around his neck. Youth A reported the cord gave him a heat
rash around his neck, which is currently gone. Youth A reported
he does not remember how he felt after the incident, but reported
he did not have any issues with breathing afterwards. Youth A
reported he then removed the cord and told Staff 1 about the rash
around his neck, and said it was a heat rash. Youth A reported
Staff 2 then got involved to help Staff 1 and gave her advice as to
what to do next. Youth A reported after he went back to his room,
Staff 2 came into his room. Youth A reported he felt anxious about
what he did and lying about it, so he admitted to Staff 2 he
wrapped the cord around his neck. Youth A reported he talked to
Staff 2 about why he did it and Staff 2 told him he couldn’t do
things like that. Youth A reported Staff 2 talked to clinical on-call
and nursing staff, which resulted in him being put on an Acute
Risk Intervention Plan (ARIP), and items being removed from his
room. Youth A reported he talked to Case Manager on 6/30/25,
2

and they discussed him using his coping skills, and talking to staff
if/when he begins having those feelings again.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 7/7/25 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported Youth A’s injury on his neck after the incident on 6/27/25
was not serious enough to warrant outside medical care. CA
reported Youth A was put on an ARIP on 6/27/25, and those are
re-assessed every 24 hours to ensure continued safety. CA
reported she talked to Youth A over the weekend of 6/27/25-
6/29/25 and Youth A reported he was using his coping skills. CA
reported there were no further incidents over the weekend.
Case Manager (CM) was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 7/7/25 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. CM reported
on 6/27/25, Clinician was on-call and put Youth A on precautions
after she was notified about the incident. CM saw the notification
when she arrived at work on 6/30/25 and checked in with Youth A.
CM reported Youth A lied to staff initially and staff thought it was a
medical concern, but Youth A then opened up to staff after the
incident and disclosed what really happened. CM reported Youth
A walked her through the situation of what happened. Youth A told
her he wrapped a cord around his neck because he felt like no
one cared about him or loved him. Youth A also told her “people”
are out to get him and “people” who don’t like him want to stab
him. CM reported she asked Youth A who these people were, and
he just said “people”, but wouldn’t give any additional specifics.
CM reported they then talked about Youth A's mother’s death a
year ago and processed that situation. CM reported Youth A does
not have the mental capacity to understand grief on his own, so
she helped him connect his grief with his suicidal ideations. CM
reported she then completed a suicide risk assessment,
depression screening and anxiety screening. CM reported he has
had those assessments previously as well. CM reported he scored
high frequency on those assessments, but it’s not abnormal for
him given his history and current feelings. CM reported his scoring
goes in waves, and it depends on how he’s feeling. CM reported
the last time he had suicidal ideations was the few weeks after his
mother’s death. CM reported Youth A used the tie from his robe
and wrapped it around his neck. CM reported Youth A was on
precautions for a month after that incident, and had all ties and
cords removed for the entire time. CM reported Youth A showed
no signs of suicidal ideations or increased anxiety/depression prior
to this occurring, so there were no warning signs. CM reported in
his therapy session on 6/26/25, Youth A mentioned something
about his mother getting a new grave, and he was looking forward
3

to visiting her, but he didn’t mention any other thoughts or
feelings. CM reported Youth A was acting normally on the unit and
during outings. CM reported Youth A spoke to his grandmother on
6/27/25, and CM suspects Youth A’s grandmother said something
about his mother during the phone call, which may have triggered
him. CM reported proper precautions were taken after the incident
occurred.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported a staff
(couldn’t remember who) called her on 6/27/25 and reported
Youth A had what looked like a heat rash on his neck. Nurse
reported there was no swelling, no itching, and no reports of Youth
A having trouble breathing. Nurse reported she recommended
staff use Hydrocortisone cream for itch if needed, and requested
they let her know if the rash spread. Nurse reported approximately
45 minutes later she received a call from Staff 2 stating Youth A
disclosed the mark on his neck was from him trying to kill himself
by wrapping a cord around his neck. Nurse reported no additional
medical treatment was necessary because Youth A was not
complaining of having difficulty breathing, and there was no
swelling present. Nurse reported an ARIP was established for
Youth A, and she told Staff 2 to call back if anything changed with
Youth A’s status or the mark on his neck.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/16/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on
6/27/25, Youth A became upset with a couple different staff and
he talked to her about this to vent/get his feelings out, which is not
atypical for him. Staff 1 reported Youth A said he wanted to calm
down in his room, so she brought him to his room. Staff 1 reported
Youth A came out within 15 minutes, stayed in the milieu for less
than 15 minutes, and then said he wanted to go back into his
room, which she allowed him to do. Staff 1 reported Youth A came
out of his room shortly after and asked to go to the bathroom, so
she let him in. Staff 1 reported Youth A exited the bathroom,
asked her about a mark on his neck and stated he didn’t know
what was going on with the mark. Staff 1 reported the mark on his
neck looked like a rash, so she consulted with Staff 2 regarding
what to do for follow-up, and Staff 2 took over the situation. Staff 1
reported she let Youth A back into his room per his request. Staff
1 reported Staff 2 went into Youth A’s room to talk to him. When
Staff 2 came out of Youth A’s room, she told Staff 1 Youth A
disclosed he wrapped a cord around his neck, and Staff 2 told
Staff 1 to clear his room of any objects he could use to hurt
himself. Staff 1 reported after she cleared his room, an ARIP was
4

completed by her and Staff 2. Staff 1 reported she did not speak
with clinical on-call or nursing staff as Staff 2 handled those calls.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/16/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she was
in the office on 6/27/25 when Staff 1 came to ask her for advice on
how to handle the situation because there were marks on Youth
A’s neck. Staff 2 reported she looked at the marks on Youth A’s
neck and it looked like an allergic reaction or a heat rash initially.
Staff 2 reported Youth A also looked a little pale. Staff 2 reported
she called Nurse and then went to Youth A’s room to ask him
questions the Nurse wanted answers to. Nurse asked if Youth A
was having trouble breathing and Staff 2 reported Youth A said
yes. Staff 2 reported Nurse advised to give Youth A allergy
medication if it was on his PRN list, and Staff 2 could not
remember Nurse’s other instructions. Staff 2 reported she hung up
the phone and Youth A asked if he could talk to her, so she stayed
in his room to talk to him. Staff 2 reported Youth A confided he
tried to kill himself, and said he tried to do it with the cord to his
radio. Staff 2 reported he did it because his mother passed away a
year ago and he was really overwhelmed. Staff 2 reported she
completed some breathing exercises with him and created a
safety plan. Staff 2 reported Youth A was worried about getting
placed on precautions, but Staff 2 told him precautions would
happen to keep him safe. Staff 2 reported Youth A said he didn’t
feel safe with cords in his room, so she took those out
immediately. Staff 2 reported she told Staff 3 what was going on
and then Staff 2 called Clinician. Staff 2 reported Clinician told her
to strip his room of any unsafe things that could cause him harm,
and those were taken out. Staff 2 reported Clinician recommended
an ARIP be established for the precautions as well. Staff 2
reported she contacted Nurse again, and Nurse recommended
writing an incident report, providing Youth A with an ice pack for
his neck, talking to clinical on-call (Clinician) and providing him
with his PRN medication if he requested it. Staff 2 reported she
was not instructed to seek additional medical care for Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/16/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she was
walking through the milieu when Staff 2 stopped her and
explained what happened with Youth A. Staff 3 reported Staff 2
asked Staff 3 to help clear his room, which she did. Staff 3
reported she saw Youth A’s neck after she was made aware of the
situation, and there was a red mark on his neck which looked like
a rash. Staff 3 reported the mark did not look like it would require
outside medical care.
5

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Report dated 6/27/25 authored by Staff 1 was
consistent with Staff 1 and Staff 2’s interviews. Youth A’s
wound was treated with an ice pack per Nurse’s direction
and Youth A was put on precautions to ensure his safety.
No further treatment was needed.
• Youth A’s Acute Risk Intervention Plan (ARIP) dated
6/27/25 and signed by Clinician states Youth A is to be
observed at least 4 times per hour, ARIP log to be filled out
every 15 minutes by staff, and objects are to be removed
from his environment (specifically cords, strings, harmful
objects).
• Youth A Treatment Note dated 7/3/25 authored by CM
outlines Youth A’s goals, objectives, interventions, and
assessments.
• DART Health Services Policy and Procedure states DART
will routinely and emergently seek medical and behavioral
health care and services for youth served. Nursing On-Call
will be contacted anytime a youth requires first aid or more
advanced medical treatment. Staff will follow the Incident
Report Policy/Procedures regarding documentation of
incidents and adverse events.
• Acute Risk Intervention Planning Procedure states if staff
believe there is a situation of acute risk, they may increase
supervision/monitoring and maximum possible safety while
they consult with designated program contact, consult the
individual’s crisis plan, and review the individual’s plan of
service/behavioral plan.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed the
facility’s health services policies as they consulted with Nurse,
consulted with Clinician, completed an incident report,
implemented safety precautions, and provided Youth A with
medical care as advised by Nurse.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
